website-directory.desc: Directory name of the website content that contains dynamic, data.*, static.* directories

allow-dumpContext.desc: If true, will allow dumpContext query parameter to display debug information instead of the output page (should be false in production)

allow-overrideInput.desc: If true, will allow overrideInput to alter the input processor class of a controller (should be false in production)

allow-overrideOutput.desc: If true, will allow overrideOutput to alter the output generator class of a controller (should be false in production)

log-level.desc: Default logging level for the context (5=debug 4=info 3=warning 2=event 1=error)

history-maxsize.desc: Number of contexts to save in history (non-error containing)

error-history-maxsize.desc: Number of error containing contexts to save in history

initial-size.desc: Number of context objects to pre-allocate, must be less than or equal to the max-size

max-size.desc: Maximum context objects to keep allocated

mask.desc: Mask to use for writing logged events (see documentation for Logging, default is errors only 0x000000ff)

max-file-size.desc: Maximum size per log file before creating a new log file and incrementing filename (in bytes, default 1MB)

cycle-sleep.desc: How long to sleeep between log write cycles, if no log messages aare available logger will keep sleeping for this time, in milliseconds, default is 1000

template-cache.desc: Template objects that are read from file and kept in a parsed state for execution

static-file-cache.desc: Static item cache (all static directories), maximum memory size is (max_items * max_filesize)

max-items.desc: Maximum number of items to store in the static cache

max-filesize.desc: Maximum number of kbytes to cache, file larger than this will be read from disk every time

cache-count.desc: Number of caches to use (must be a prime number)

data-file-cache.desc: Data item cache (all data directories), maximum memory size is (max_items * max_filesize)

max-items.desc: Maximum number of items to store in the static cache

max-filesize.desc: Maximum number of kbytes to cache, file larger than this will be read from disk every time

cache-count.desc: Number of caches to use (must be a prime number)

host.desc: Hostname or IP of the network interface to bind to, empty implies first available

listener-sleep.desc: Milliseconds to sleep while waiting for a connection

host.desc: Hostname or IP of the network interface to bind to, empty implies first available

listener-sleep.desc: Milliseconds to sleep while waiting for a connection

cert.desc: Relative path from aos_root base for the certificate file

pkey.desc: Relative path from aos_root base for the private key file

host.desc: Hostname or IP of the network interface to bind to, empty implies first available

url.desc: SQLite3 database in ./aos_root/db/AObjectServer.db, relative to the directory with executable

hostname.desc: Hostname reported to clients, this is used if request Host field is missing. If this is empty and Host is missing then local ip is used.

server.desc: Server field in the response http header, usually identifies server type and version

http.desc: Reported HTTP port, none means use 80

https.desc: Reported HTTPS port, none means use 443

minimum-threshold.desc: Compress files larger than this, in bytes

base.desc: This is the default language for the base directory

remap.desc: Allows some locales to be remapped or when more than one locale can exist for a given language, default will do xx-yy, then xx, then use default

lang.desc: Remap locale en is effectively en-us, since more than one en-XX can exist
lang.name: en

sleep.desc: Milliseconds to sleep while checking for a shutdown, default is 3000

error-templates.desc: HTTP status response templates, located relative to aos_data directory

default.desc: Default template when a status code does not have an explicit template

default-mime-type.desc: MIME type to use when it cannot be mapped from the mime-types file and extension of the controller

mime-types.desc: Filename that contains MIME mappings based on controller's extension

holder-size.desc: Number of buckets (hash based, prime better) to use for holding session maps

timeout.desc: Number of milliseconds since session was last used and expires

sleep-cycle.desc: Number of milliseconds to sleep between checking sessions for exipration, default is 3000

blocking.desc: Use blocking or non-blocking socket IO

first-char-read-tries.desc: Number of times to try and read the first character

first-char-sleep-start.desc: Initial sleep time trying to read first character

first-char-sleep-increment.desc: Amount to increment the sleep time for each try

wait-for-http-data-timeout.desc: Milliseconds to wait for complete header after initial byte before giving up, in ms

http11-pipelining-enabled.desc: Enabled pipelining if keep-alive is specified

unavailable-sleep-time.desc: Milliseconds to sleep while trying to flush the output and the socket is unavailable (would block)

unavailable-retries.desc: Number of retries (sleeps) while waiting for an unavailable socket

queues.desc: Queues in the is-available queue manager, each queue has single select thread

loop-delay.desc: Milliseconds of sleep between bulk selects

empty-queue-sleep-delay.desc: Milliseconds of sleep when there are no more clients to process and before checking queue again

no-data-timeout.desc: Milliseconds before a socket is closed due to inactivity

threads.desc: Threads in the pre-executor queue manager

queues.desc: Queues in the pre-executor queue manager

sleep-delay.desc: Milliseconds of sleep when there are no more clients to process and before checking queue again

threads.desc: Threads in the executor queue manager

queues.desc: Queues in the executor queue manager

queues.desc: Queues in the executor queue manager

base-http-dir.desc: Location of admin site relative to the root directory
